articles.title: Pres. Kim Il Sung's feats lauded
articles.content:
Pres. Kim Il Sung's feats lauded
Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA -- Chief of the Defense Staff Abdulsalam Alhaji Abubakar, who was heading the Nigerian military delegation, praised the exploits of  President Kim Il Sung when he was interviewed by a KCNA reporter.
   Noting that Korea made great achievements in a short span of time under the wise guidance of President Kim Il Sung, he said: the president devoted all his life to happiness of the people.
   Referring to the President's people-oriented policies, he said that best policies have been shaped in Korea to provide everyone with a stable and happy life.
   The President's feats are being exalted by the respected Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il, he stressed.

articles.title: Institution of Juche Era and Sun's Day welcomed by Koreans in Russia
articles.content:
Institution of Juche Era and Sun's Day welcomed by Koreans in Russia
  Moscow, August 8 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Moscow on August 6 under the sponsorship of the United Confederation of Koreans (Kothongryon) in Russia and other organizations of Korean residents in Russia, to hail the resolution "on exalting the President Kim Il Sung's revolutionary life and great achievements for all ages".
   The resolution was read out at the meeting before speeches were made by the chairman of the Russian Kothongryon, the vice-chairman of the international Kothongryon, and others.
   The speakers expressed full support to the resolution on instituting the Juche Era with 1912 as the first year when President Kim Il Sung was born as the sun of Juche and defining his birthday April 15 as Sun's Day.
   They said the resolution reflects the ardent wish of the entire Koreans in the north, the south and overseas to hold President Kim Il Sung in high esteem for all ages as the sun of Juche.
   They hardened their determination to exalt his revolutionary life and great achievements for all ages and devote everything to the reunification and prosperity of the homeland under the guidance of the respected General Kim Jong Il.
   A letter to the General was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: New DPRK Ambassador to Cuba appointed
articles.content:
New DPRK Ambassador to Cuba appointed
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Kil Hwan was appointed as DPRK Ambassador e.p. to Cuba, according to a decree of the DPRK Central People's Committee.

articles.title: Koreans in China vow to wage joint struggle for national reunification
articles.content:
Koreans in China vow to wage joint struggle for national reunification
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Korean Nationals in China made public a statement supporting the declaration on national reunification, which was published by the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon) to mark the 25th anniversary of the July 4 Joint Statement.
   The statement expressed full support to the declaration, saying it reflects the desire and will of the entire fellow countrymen for the reunification and clarifies the principles and method of solving the reunification question on the basis of the noble idea of the July 4 Joint Statement.
   The Federation recognizes as the most appropriate and realistic way of reunification the confederacy formula based on one nation, one state, two systems and two governments, proposed by President Kim Il Sung, it stressed.
   The statement said: 
   In active response to the declaration of Pomminryon, the Federation will arouse the entire Korean residents in China to the joint struggle to smash the separatist moves of  Kim Young Sam and reunify the country through great solidarity of the north, south and overseas Koreans.

articles.title: Paper on Japan's ambition for overseas expansion
articles.content:
Paper on Japan's ambition for overseas expansion
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The main purpose of the Japanese reactionaries' review of the "guidelines for Japan-U.S. defense cooperation" is to invade any region and any country in Asia in league with the United States on the pretext of "joint reaction to emergency around Japan."
   Rodong Sinmun today stresses this in a commentary, which continues:
   Asian countries are watchful, regarding the review of the "guidelines" as potential aggression on them.
   In a bid to dull the vigilance of neighbouring countries, the Japanese reactionaries openly describe the review as simulating "a change on the Korean Peninsula" and as aimed at coping with "crisis caused by north Korea."
   The review, however, is not only targeted at the Korean Peninsula.
   The Japanese reactionaries claim that the concept of area around Japan should not be taken merely from the geographical point of view. 
   They imply that the Asia-Pacific region, which has political, economic, military and strategic importance, is included in the area around Japan. in other words, they mean all countries in this region, and the review of the "guidelines" is aimed at aggression on these countries.
   This reveals their aggressive ambition to open the way for unlimited overseas expansion.
   With no trick, however, can they conceal their wild ambition and dull the vigilance of Asian countries.

articles.title: Results of preliminary meeting for "four-way talks" are below DPRK's expectations
articles.content:
Results of preliminary meeting for "four-way talks" are below DPRK's expectations 
 Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea in an interview with KCNA today referred to the results of the preliminary meeting for "four-way talks" recently held in New York.
   He told KCNA:
   The results of the August 5-7 preliminary meeting held in New York are, in a nutshell, below our expectations.   Thanks to our broad-minded effort, tentative agreement was reached at the preliminary meeting on a series of matters such as the level of participants, the venue and procedures of the "four-way talks." however, there were raised seriously conflicting views on some key issues such as the agenda.
   Our main principle concerning the agenda is that the "four-way talks" should not discuss internal affairs of our nation in any case and, accordingly, the agenda of the talks should be defined in concrete and explicit terms.
   The conclusion of a peace agreement between the DPRK and the United States and the U.S. troop pullout, which we proposed as the agenda items, are the key to the preservation of peace on the Korean Peninsula. at the same time, these issues cannot be settled between north and south Korea.
   If there are no such issues, there is no reason to hold "four-way talks" including foreign countries concerned, because the issues that can be settled between north and south Korea have all been agreed upon and specified in documents. 
   The United States, however, refused to accept such issues as agenda items and insisted on Generalising the agenda items so that other issues can be discussed.
   We suspect that the U.S. intends to avoid its responsibility and interfere in internal affairs of our nation.
   What also disappointed us was the U.S. position that food assistance to the DPRK can be expanded only after the "four-way talks" are opened.
   With serious food problem, we guard against possible use of food assistance to the DPRK as a political weapon at the "four-way talks."
   The U.S. attitude at the preliminary meeting added fuel to our fear.
   The preliminary meeting also proved that we were right in fearing that the inequality in mutual relations between the parties to the talks may affect the principle of impartiality in discussions.
   Because the U.S. fortunately came out to the negotiation table, though belatedly, in response to our long-time call for terminating the armistice and establishing a lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula, we will watch their attitude for some more time.
